title: Why Dynamic Queue is Better than Solo Queue.

replies.body: http://images-cdn.9gag.com/photo/aXX3GmD_700b_v1.jpg

To play the devil's advocate this happened in Solo/DuoQ, too. The issue now is that with premades if one of them is a retard/good they all will probably be retards/good together. It makes your odds of having a shitty game favor the more polarizing ends of the spectrum. Basically I'd rather have a few kinda good and kinda shitty matches over a few really good and really shitty matches. Those really good ones don't feel earned and the really shitty ones ruin your whole goddamn mood.
Fucking Brilliant. +1 forever

The thing is, dynamic que is actually quite good.

What's not is how they fucked up ranked by opening the flood gates for larger groups. That, however, is not actually a part of what makes dynamic que. It's an alternate facet they simply added to the system. All that dynamic que is the role select and matching, which genuinely is solid  - but not flawless - addition to the que.

Jesus chirst, how many times will this have to be repeated.

Champ select is NOT dynamic que.

Dynamic, is allowing soloes being matched with premade groups!
If you account for the people that think Dynamic Queue and Champ Select are the same, you'd lose half the DynaQ supporters
Im guessing that this was an intentional deceit on Riots part to support their fuckery
Love to see some statistics for that.

Don't have the power.

We, as players, can't survey everyone on the ingame client, as Riot does.

What we can do is survey using social mediums, Reddit, Boards, youtube vids, and whatnot.

Whenever people use those as statistics "Omg, that's biased, you can't use those"

Well where can we get statistics otherwise?

You have that backwards and I'm not sure how.

* Champion Select is the ability to choose your preferred roles.
* Dynamic Queue is the ability to play with larger groups.

They are two separate things and I really can't understand how so many can't differentiate the two.

Riot introduced them at the same time so that they could attribute any of the positive effects of NCS to DQ, effectively fudging the data in order to support their stupid new queue and avoid bringing back old queues.

So I get why the two are mixed up, they were introduced as a single package, and nobody wants to go through the hell of Blind pick to notice the difference.
https://cdn.meme.am/instances/67017731.jpg
I actually refreshed this twice before I caught on lmfao, Good one!

solo isn't better than dynamic. anyone who disagrees is wrong.
This potato is a tomato. Anyone who disagrees is no true scotsman.

> anyone who disagrees is wrong

typical excuse of an argument used by DynamicQ fanboys
honestly, it's because whenever we use any other argument you cover your ears and start yelling.
HEY, I DONT COVER UP MY EARS AND YELL, I SWEAR!

I kinda agree with him in a sense tho ,-,
Whenever someone tries to bring up a good point of DQ they automatically get downvoted to hell and then spammed with comments basically saying that it is not and you are a scrub or something like that.
The thing is, there isn't any good point. Most of these DQ lovers confuse the new champ select with DQ and that's why they are downvoted. They can't tell the difference.

This is actually very true!
And personally I love the new champ select 030/
I've finally gotten to the point where when I pick Jungle and Support I get both roles evenly :D

Do you have an argument that you'd like to share with the class?

Or do you think the new Champion Select and Dynamic Queue are the same thing? Because they're not.

champ select and dynamic are different. and your stupid for making that observation because you don't even know what it means. do you select role in champ select? no. do you find team mates in champ select? no.

there are three parts of the blanket "dynamic queue"

queueing with your role dynamically                               -this is small scale dynamic
queueing with as many friends as team size allows
and a champion select with pick preference.                -this is new champ select.


the third one is nameless, and only falls into the blanket term, which is dynamic queue.

but of course, I could explain this all day every day to everyone in the goddam boards, and people would still use your system, because dyna haters cover their ears whenever anyone disagrees with anything they think.

You know that they tested new champ select on the PBE just by itself (you probably didn't know that cause you were to busy covering your ears and screaming).  Dynamic Q is the removal of Solo and Ranked 5's
I refreshed once before I understood the true masterpiece that was on the screen

I sat here for like 10 minutes waiting for a GIF to load

LMFAO

> [{quoted}](name=Enemy Feeder,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=psN899Xp,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-06-12T19:25:02.745+0000)
>
> 

So deep.  I'm crying. 10/10

Was gone to for a weekend, glad that now i'm back people haven't started losing their minds thinking DQ is good.

Phew.
To understand this post, I had to look deep inside my soul. It said  "Dynamic Que sucks".  Ok.

Awesome review you clearly covered everything the people wanted to hear !

10/10 - That toxic jungle player
I refreshed way to many times until I realized..
I was so ready to counter your aguments... well played.

DQ is a mess even if Riot fixes all the problems they mentioned because it's fundamentally broken, as [pointed out before it was even launched](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/b0VZUOVk-the-real-problem-with-dynamic-ques-isnt-matchmaking-imbalance)

Gif if taking 10 minutes to load 

11/10 Hype train

but like, Dynamic Q isn't actually that bad.  my main complaint is that role selection isn't 100% (but it's still way better than old version because of new champ select) and the Q times are a bit long.  the matches have been pretty fair for me so far and as long as I look to see that the enemy has a premade (they will if you do) I know just to play more cautiously against the enemy

> [{quoted}](name=Gnart Even Close,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=psN899Xp,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2016-06-12T21:06:26.944+0000)
>
> but like, Dynamic Q isn't actually that bad.  my main complaint is that role selection isn't 100% (but it's still way better than old version because of new champ select) and the Q times are a bit long.  the matches have been pretty fair for me so far and as long as I look to see that the enemy has a premade (they will if you do) I know just to play more cautiously against the enemy

You like new champ select! (role selection hint hint)  dynamicq is the premade vs solo thing

no actually, I like dynamic Q.  I thought the fact that I specifically mentioned new champ select as a separate thing made that clear.  I like premades because it has a more coordinated environment and I can play with friends.
Reported
but you're the feeder... i'm supposed to report you
You can only report **intentional** feeding. Non-intentional feeding is not reportable and reports of it are ignored.

non-intentional feeding ...

*proceeds to walk under enemy turret and dies*

"DW guys im Non-Intentional feeding the turrets so that when we kill them our team will get shutdown gold!"

>Dynamic Q isn't actually that bad. my main complaint is that role selection isn't 100%

Read as: _"Dynamic Q isn't that bad, so I will not post any arguments and jump straight to the Role Selection, which isn't Dynamic Queue."_

but like here's the thing.  I was saying what I didn't like, not what I did.  I like being able to play with friends.  I like being able to have a more coordinated environment where it isn't a giant free-for-all.  I like that it's still being improved upon by Rito.  I like that it's less toxic than Solo Q (and it's not just due to the new champ select, they actually compared the difference in numbers between ranked and dynamic Q).  there are other parts, but these are the main ones I'm concerned about.  It may not be perfect, but it's a hell of a lot better than Yolo Q

> [{quoted}](name=Gnart Even Close,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=psN899Xp,comment-id=000900010000,timestamp=2016-06-12T21:58:46.600+0000)

I like being able to have a more coordinated environment where it isn't a giant free-for-all.  I like that it's still being improved upon by Rito.  I like that it's less toxic than Solo Q (and it's not just due to the new champ select, they actually compared the difference in numbers between ranked and dynamic Q).  there are other parts, but these are the main ones I'm concerned about.  It may not be perfect, but it's a hell of a lot better than Yolo Q

So how do you feel about ranked 5s removal.  Sounds like it's exactly what you want.

no.  i tried to play ranked 5s, but it never works because it's really difficult to get 5 people together.  dynamic q means I can actually play with people even if everyone isn't on.  furthermore, that is an entirely different q than normal ranked, meaning it doesn't really count.  also in ranked 5s, you could match diamonds with bronze without using smurfs.

that being said, I do wish they had some version of ranked teams using clubs.  someone had an interesting ranked clubs post a while ago

Okay so here's something you should know. If you are less than 3, there's no need for DQ. If you are above 3, there's still no need for DQ cos if you can be 4, then definitely you can find someone to fill up the 5th spot. Go online. There are websites were people search for teams. Now the main reason for DQ is 3 premades.
